SolidFrame

Overview
The C++ cross-platform framework for scalable, asynchronous, distributed client-server applications

Here is a list with what the framework is offering:

Version 1.0:

  1. A system library which wraps up threads, synchronization, thread specific, file access, socket address, debug logging engine etc.
  2. Asynchronous notification engine.
  3. Asynchronous communication engine.
  4. Secure Socket support for the asynchronous TCP communication, using OpenSSL library(http://www.openssl.org/).
  5. Asynchronous multiplexed IPC (Inter Process Communication) / RPC (Remote Procedure Call) engine, over UDP.
  6. A buffer oriented, asynchronous ready, binary serialization/marshaling engine - for binary protocols like the one used by IPC.
  7. A buffer oriented, asynchronous ready, text protocol engine (parser and response builder) for protocols like IMAP, POP, SMTP etc.
  8. An implementation of fast multi-Paxos algorithm.
  9. A file stream manager for asynchronous usage (e.g. if one wants a read-only stream for a file which is locked for writing, the manager will asynchronously send the stream when unlocked).
  10. An audit/log engine completed with a debug logging engine.
  11. Doxygen documentation.
  12. Lots of example applications, including a central proof of concept multi-service server.
Links

Home Page: http://code.google.com/p/solidframe/
Wiki: http://code.google.com/p/solidframe/w/list
Download page: http://code.google.com/p/solidframe/downloads/list
Fetch latest source: svn checkout http://solidframe.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ solidframe-read-only

Documentation:

API Documentation generated by Doxygen can be found here.

Getting Started

First read the Overview wiki for a brief introduction on what SolidFrame is and can do.

Then read the Testing wiki for how to build and test the examples.

Then if you are interested in developing on top of SolidFrame, read Develop wiki.
